newsitem.title: UK: Turkey tenders to buy 25,000 tonnes of gasoline.
newsitem.headline: Turkey tenders to buy 25,000 tonnes of gasoline.

text.p: Turkey has tendered to buy 25,000 tonnes of low octane gasoline for arrival in mid August, traders said on Wednesday.
Oil group Tupras closes the tender on August 4 and will announce the winner two days later.
With gasoline supplies extremely tight in the Mediterranean competition will be fierce to secure those cargoes available to meet the tender, traders said.
"I can only see two Romanian cargoes for August and not much else. It is a very tight market," said one trader.
European gasoline prices have been riding on the crest of a U.S. driven price rally which has also been supported by a lack of supplies in both NWE and the Med.
More plentiful supplies of gasoline are not anticipated before August 15, but once these become available prices should start to ease.
"These cargoes will have to go the United States, there won't be the demand for them in Europe," said one trader.
